intro: Jamesonia imbricata var. imbricata, commonly known as the mountain hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its botanical features include a stout, hairy stem and numerous small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
